item.name: Citrix Database connected
item.description: Manages deployment of Storefront.

item.name: Service Citrix AD Identity Service
item.description: Manages Active Directory Computer Accounts

item.name: Service Citrix Analytics
item.description: Manages Active Directory Computer Accounts

item.name: Service Citrix Broker Service
item.description: The Citrix Broker service provides configuration and allows brokering of connections to desktops and applications.

item.name: Service Citrix Configuration Logging Service
item.description: Logs Administrator activity and configuration changes in a XenDesktop deployment

item.name: Service Citrix Configuration Service
item.description: Stores service configuration information.

item.name: Service Citrix Delegated Administration Service
item.description: Manages configuration of delegated administration permissions.

item.name: Service Citrix Diagnostic Facility COM Server
item.description: Manages and controls Citrix diagnostic trace sessions on the system.

item.name: Service Citrix Environment Test Service
item.description: Manages tests for evaluating the state of a XenDesktop Site

item.name: Service Citrix Host Service
item.description: Manages tests for evaluating the state of a XenDesktop Site

item.name: Service Citrix Machine Creation Service
item.description: Creates new Virtual Machines

item.name: Service Citrix Monitor Service
item.description: This service monitors the FlexCast system.

item.name: Service Citrix Storefront Privileged Administration Service
item.description: Manages privileged operations on Storefront..

item.name: Service Citrix Storefront Service
item.description: Manages deployment of Storefront.

item.name: Service Citrix Desktop Service
item.description: The Citrix Desktop Service manages communication between the delivery controller and virtual desktops. It handles initial brokering of connections, settings for connections, and interaction with sessions.

item.name: Service Citrix Device Redirector Service
item.description: Service to manage Citrix remote devices

item.name: Service Citrix Diagnostic Facility COM Server
item.description: Manages and controls Citrix diagnostic trace sessions on the system.

item.name: Service Citrix Encryption Service
item.description: Enables secure communication with RC5 128-bit encryption between Citrix Delivery Clients and this Citrix XenApp server

item.name: Service Citrix End User Experiencing Monitoring
item.description: Service to collect and collate end user experience measurements

item.name: Service Citrix Group Policy Engine
item.description: Responsible for applying settings configured by Citrix administrators for the computer and users through the Group Policy component.

item.name: Service Citrix HDX MediaStream for Flash Service
item.description: Provides the HDX MediaStream for Flash feature to published applications and virtual desktops. HDX MediaStream for Flash allows the Adobe Flash Player to run on the client user device instead of within the server session.

item.name: Service Citrix Location and Sensor Virtual Channel Service
item.description: Enables a server side application to leverage Location and Sensor capabilities.

item.name: Service Citrix Mobile Receiver Virtual Channel Service
item.description: Enables a server side application to use mobile device capabilities.

item.name: Service Citrix MultiTouch Redirection Service
item.description: Provides MultiTouch redirection between the endpoint device and the virtual desktop.

item.name: Service Citrix Print Manager Service
item.description: This service supports the Citrix Advanced Universal Printing Architecture.

item.name: Service Citrix Profile Management
item.description: Manages user personalization settings

item.name: Service Citrix Pvs for VMs agent
item.description: Pvs for VMs agent machine password update service

item.name: Service Citrix Services Manager
item.description: Citrix Services Manager

item.name: Service Citrix Smart Card Service
item.description: Provides Smart Card redirection between the endpoint device and the virtual desktop.

item.name: Service Citrix Stack Control Service
item.description: Rpc/Com Translation Service

item.name: Agent ping
item.description: The agent always returns 1 for this item. It could be used in combination with nodata() for availability check.

item.name: Processor % Load
item.description: perf_counter[\Processor Information(_Total)\% Processor Time]

item.name: Service DNS Client
item.description: The DNS Client service (dnscache) caches Domain Name System (DNS) names and registers the full computer name for this computer. If the service is stopped, DNS names will continue to be resolved. However, the results of DNS name queries will not be cached and the computer's name will not be registered. If the service is disabled, any services that explicitly depend on it will fail to start.

item.name: Service Group Policy Client
item.description: The service is responsible for applying settings configured by administrators for the computer and users through the Group Policy component. If the service is disabled, the settings will not be applied and applications and components will not be manageable through Group Policy. Any components or applications that depend on the Group Policy component might not be functional if the service is disabled.

item.name: Service Local Session Manager
item.description: Core Windows Service that manages local user sessions. Stopping or disabling this service will result in system instability.

item.name: Service Netlogon
item.description: service is disabled, any services that explicitly depend on it will fail to start.

item.name: Service Print Spooler
item.description: This service spools print jobs and handles interaction with the printer. If you turn off this service, you wont be able to print or see your printers.

item.name: Service Remote Procedure Call (RPC)
item.description: The RPCSS service is the Service Control Manager for COM and DCOM servers. It performs object activations requests, object exporter resolutions and distributed garbage collection for COM and DCOM servers. If this service is stopped or disabled, programs using COM or DCOM will not function properly. It is strongly recommended that you have the RPCSS service running.

item.name: Service RPC Endpoint Mapper
item.description: Resolves RPC interfaces identifiers to transport endpoints. If this service is stopped or disabled, programs using Remote Procedure Call (RPC) services will not function properly.

item.name: Service Security Accounts Manager
item.description: The startup of this service signals other services that the Security Accounts Manager (SAM) is ready to accept requests. Disabling this service will prevent other services in the system from being notified when the SAM is ready, which may in turn cause those services to fail to start correctly. This service should not be disabled.

item.name: Service User Profile Service
item.description: This service is responsible for loading and unloading user profiles. If this service is stopped or disabled, users will no longer be able to successfully sign in or sign out, apps might have problems getting to users' data, and components registered to receive profile event notifications won't receive them.

item.name: Service Windows Event Log
item.description: This service manages events and event logs. It supports logging events, querying events, subscribing to events, archiving event logs, and managing event metadata. It can display events in both XML and plain text format. Stopping this service may compromise security and reliability of the system.

item.name: Service Windows Management Instrumentation
item.description: Provides a common interface and object model to access management information about operating system, devices, applications and services. If this service is stopped, most Windows-based software will not function properly. If this service is disabled, any services that explicitly depend on it will fail to start.

item.name: Service Workstation
item.description: Creates and maintains client network connections to remote servers using the SMB protocol. If this service is stopped, these connections will be unavailable. If this service is disabled, any services that explicitly depend on it will fail to start.

discovery_rule.name: Network interface discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of network interfaces as defined in global regular expression "Network interfaces for discovery".

Service Citrix Mobile Receiver Virtual Channel Service: {ITEM.VALUE1}
